posts.post_content:
She gives Razia a run for her money.  
But why bit them against ech other when can you use BOTH?  
They work decent toghether actually. Gisela yield Razia that she NOT made of cardboard (duh) and Razia's can actually smack meanies on another side of the board for a whooping six!  
  
Also it's note worthy that her first ability is kinda political in multiplayer, with opponents smacking each other for double damage.  
  
It's nice knowing that with that angel lady and [Slayer's Stronghold](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Slayer's Stronghold) (and mabe, mabe other shinies in Return to Ravnica?) Boros can hit a buck once again.

Posted By: Cloudeye (5/19/2012 7:12:20 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
EDIT: Having just drafted a Gisela last week, I feel I must say-  
HOLY CRAP.  
She won me a game where I was at 4 life, and my opponent at almost 30.  
Needless to say, that guy *hated* her... and I fell in love.  
  
She'll make for a *great* Boros General-  
her only real drawback is vulnerability to removal,  
which can be compensated for with [Lightning Greaves](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lightning Greaves) or the like.  
  
Then, add [Hostility](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hostility) and cast [Comet Storm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Comet Storm)-  
A horde of 6/2 Hasted Elementals is likely to end the game rather quickly.  
  
Also, I \*really\* want to run her with [Mirror Gallery](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mirror Gallery) and [Infinite Reflection](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Infinite Reflection),  
just to make the game impossible to play without a calculator.

posts.post_content:
Everyone is pointing out the combo with [Kaalia](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kaalia), but no-one has mentioned another card from the same Commander deck as her that combos great with Gisela. [Pyrohemia](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Pyrohemia). Get both on the table and it's "R: Pyrohemia deals 2 damage to each opponent and each creature they control, and no damage to you or your creatures".  
  
Edit: ClowWizardEriol, the damage prevented is rounded up. Rounding up 1/2 a point of damage prevented equals 1 point of damage prevented, thus she prevents all the damage [Pyrohemia](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Pyrohemia) would deal to you and creatures you control.

Posted By: Saikuba (5/16/2012 11:49:56 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I've been waiting for this card.  
  
I'm a R/W player, through and through, and this card just makes me happier than I can probably express.  
  
It was depressing to go through Innistrad and Dark Ascension, with their arbitrary decision to focus on ally colored cards and to ignore enemy colored cards. But, this single card manages to make up for all of that.  
  
It's a legendary mythic creature. Effectively the highest tier a creature can exist in, and the first R/W one ever printed. And, it actually pushes the boundaries of just how powerful a creature can be, being a virtual 10/10 first strike flyer for seven mana, which alone would be tremendously powerful but her abilities extend far, far beyond that.  
  
When you throw in the fact that she's a beautiful angel, I'm just so happy that this card exists. It's like I've been rewarded for not giving up hope, which I guess is the core theme of Avacyn Restored.
posts.html:

It's a legendary mythic creature. Effectively the highest tier a creature can exist in, and the first R/W one ever printed. And, it actually pushes the boundaries of just how powerful a creature can be, being a virtual 10/10 first strike flyer for seven mana, which alone would be tremendously powerful but her abilities extend far, far beyond that.

When you throw in the fact that she's a beautiful angel, I'm just so happy that this card exists. It's like I've been rewarded for not giving up hope, which I guess is the core theme of Avacyn Restored.

posts.post_content:
[Kaalia](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kaalia)'s army of Angel's, Demons, and Dragons couldn't be complete without the shining blade of Goldnight aiding her resolve.   
  
At first, her, [Avacyn,](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Avacyn,) and [Griselbrand](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Griselbrand) settled their dispute for the greater good of Kaalia, but they soon realized that the demon was just too powerful, and banned him from the format.  
  
And no, it wasn't a banning community or WotC, it was the angels. 100% not a lie to make a cool story.
posts.html:

At first, her, Avacyn, and Griselbrand settled their dispute for the greater good of Kaalia, but they soon realized that the demon was just too powerful, and banned him from the format.

And no, it wasn't a banning community or WotC, it was the angels. 100% not a lie to make a cool story.

すごい! (Amazing!)  
  
This card is just awesome. Massive destructive power, but can be killed by any exile, sacrifice, and counter effect. It needs to be a bit harder to get on the field, tho. Turn seven is a death sentence when used in a WR deck. I use it within a WG deck with [Cavern of Souls](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cavern of Souls) and [Rampant Growth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rampant Growth). works well, especially with my [Craterhoof Behemoth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Craterhoof Behemoth). (oh dear god its evil when you pull off that combo)  
  
4.5/5 ^\_^

Posted By: Paepay (7/1/2012 1:33:46 AM)

posts.post_content:
I would say she is great in multi-player, but in my experience playing her equals instant death on your part. Someone may take advantage of the doubling to kill someone else as well if they can also kill you that turn.  
  
Great fun with anything else that says "Double" and also any impressive burn. My personal favorite for her in EDH is [Brightflame](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Brightflame). Assuming you play it the next turn and have 8 mana to work with, you have 8 damage to their general and hence to all their non-colorless creatures... then gain that much life. If you lose after that, you messed up or got really unlucky.  
  
Just for fun, lets say you play her, Four [Furnace of Rath](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Furnace of Rath), four [Inquisitor's flail](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Inquisitor's flail), Four [Quest for Pure Flame](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Quest for Pure Flame) and four [Gratuitous Violence](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gratuitous Violence). (I know how impossible this all is, and I know that I could go further) Swing for 5\*2^(17) = 655,360 Damage.
posts.html:
I would say she is great in multi-player, but in my experience playing her equals instant death on your part. Someone may take advantage of the doubling to kill someone else as well if they can also kill you that turn.

Great fun with anything else that says "Double" and also any impressive burn. My personal favorite for her in EDH is Brightflame. Assuming you play it the next turn and have 8 mana to work with, you have 8 damage to their general and hence to all their non-colorless creatures... then gain that much life. If you lose after that, you messed up or got really unlucky.

Just for fun, lets say you play her, Four Furnace of Rath, four Inquisitor's flail, Four Quest for Pure Flame and four Gratuitous Violence. (I know how impossible this all is, and I know that I could go further) Swing for 5*2^(17) = 655,360 Damage.
